snippet: At a time when e-book sales seem to be flattening, there is something to be learned from Kevin Kelly’s self-published print catalog, a collection of reviews accrued from a website over the years.
abstract: David Carr The Media Equation column says at a time when e-book sales seem to be flattening, there is something to be learned from Kevin Kelly’s self-published print catalog, collection of reviews accrued from a website over the years that sold extremely well; contends print continues to be remarkable technology, if not as lucrative as it used to be, with its own durable glories.
lead_paragraph: At a time when e-book sales seem to be flattening, there is something to be learned from Kevin Kelly’s self-published print catalog, a collection of reviews accrued from a website over the years.

headline.main: Print Starts to Settle Into Its Niches
headline.print_headline: Print Starts to Settle Into Its Niches
